attributes.action: Men diagnosed with testicular cancer have hormones tested before orchidectomy
attributes.additional_details: Instruct urologists in the NHS to check hormones before the removal of testicle when a man is diagnosed with testicular cancer
attributes.background: Currently most men diagnosed with testicular cancer have the orchidectomy ( removal of testicle)  with no hormone levels checked before. It’s been proven that 2 out of 5 men’s testosterone never recovers after. Having a base line to work from will greatly increase their chances of treatment after

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a clinical decision for the NHS.
